cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the north-western Gulf Coast (Louisiana-upper Texas) early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast (likely southeast or south-central Louisiana)

port.name: Port of Greater Baton Rouge, LA

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to the upper Texas coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) are possible around 72–96 h with a peak probability of 6 %.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Early guidance suggests minor to moderate surge (2–4 ft) could reach lower portions of the Mississippi River and adjacent bays.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands associated with MARCO could bring 3–6 inches with locally higher totals, producing flash-flood potential in and around Baton Rouge.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands and river rises that could hinder port logistics.
